placeMetadata.name: Saheliyon ki bari

sources.snippet: Saheliyon ki Bari | #4 of 11 Best Historical Places in Udaipur. Built in the 18 th century by Maharana Sangram Singh, Saheliyon ki Bari (or the Garden of the Maidens) is well-known for its beautiful fountains, lush lawns and marble structures. According to legends, the king himself had designed the plan of this garden for his beloved queen and the 48 maidens who accompanied her in marriage.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Historical Places in Udaipur in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: Having its name literally translate to ‚ÄúGarden of the Maidens‚Äù, Saheliyon ki Bari is a historical garden at the heart of Udaipur. The garden was initially built by Raja Rana Sanga of Mewar as a gift for his Queen and her many maidens. One of the most popular historical places in Udaipur among couples, the garden is known for its quiet beauty.
sources.shortName: 20 Historical Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: The Saheliyon Ki Bari is adorned with marble elephants, carved kiosks, and several fountains in each of its four swimming pools. The lotus lakes and bird fountains are two of the garden‚Äôs many notable features. One white marble kiosk in the middle and four black marble kiosks in each of the four corners adorn the garden‚Äôs central reservoir.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: Saheliyon ki Bari is another wonder with a concept built around needs of ladies. Chhatris and ponds are features implemented to provide shade and coolness for summers. The lush green lawns, marble arts and fountains present a green retreat to the dry land of Rajasthan.
sources.shortName: Architecture of Udaipur, Architectural Features of Udaipur

sources.snippet: Also known as the 'Garden of Friends', this lush green oasis was constructed as a retreat where the queen could unwind with her ladies. It features intricate marble arches and delightful fountains.
sources.shortName: Historical Places Near Udaipur : Most Famous Historical Places in Udaipur

The garden also houses a museum displaying household items and pets of the residents.

reviews.reviewText:
We‚Äôd highly recommend visiting this place. It‚Äôs incredibly well maintained and thoughtfully kept‚Äîhonestly one of the most beautiful gardens we‚Äôve been to. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you can truly slow down and enjoy your time. The best part? It only costs ‚Çπ40 per person, which is a total steal for how serene and pretty it is.

Yes, like many public spaces, some people still litter‚Äîbut the staff here does a great job cleaning up and preserving the beauty of the space.

This part isn‚Äôt just about the garden, but we feel it needs to be said: even if you have a small platform, use it to spread the message. Please be responsible when you‚Äôre out in public. Carry a small bag, collect your trash, and dispose of it properly. It‚Äôs such a small thing, but it makes a huge difference.

Happy holidaying‚Äîand let‚Äôs keep our shared spaces beautiful.

One of the beautiful and serene place in the heart of Udaipur city. The greenery of the garden and multiple non-stop fountains add more charm to the place.
One can easily spend time here strolling around the garden and admiring it's beauty. The place is well maintained by the government. There is small entrance fee which can be taken at the entrance itself.

"Beautiful Garden of Udaipur ‚Äì Saheliyon Ki Bari"

Saheliyon Ki Bari is a truly beautiful and refreshing place to visit in Udaipur. The garden is well-maintained with lush greenery, lotus ponds, fountains, and marble pavilions that reflect the royal charm of the city. üå∏üíß

It‚Äôs very peaceful to walk around here, and the historic design gives a glimpse of how the royal ladies once spent their leisure time. The fountains, especially when running, make the whole place feel magical.

A perfect spot for photography, relaxation, and enjoying nature in the heart of the city. Definitely worth a visit!

Saheliyon ki Bari is one of the most beautiful places to see in Udaipur.
This historic garden was built by the king for the royal ladies and even today it feels very special and peaceful.
The garden is full of green lawns, tall trees, colorful flowers, marble pavilions and lovely fountains.

The best part is the calm atmosphere.
Even if there are many visitors, you can still find a quiet spot to sit and enjoy the cool breeze and the sound of water.
The lotus pond is very pretty and the fountains with marble elephants are perfect for photos.
Every corner looks like a picture so don‚Äôt forget your camera.

There is also a small museum inside the garden that shows old paintings, household items and royal antiques. It makes the visit even more interesting. The entry ticket is very reasonable, and the garden is well maintained and clean.

Overall, Saheliyon ki Bari is not very big but it is a must-visit place in Udaipur. If you want to enjoy nature, history and a peaceful time away from the busy city, this garden is the perfect spot.

I recently visited this place in Udaipur and I must say it is one of the most aesthetic and peaceful places I have ever been to the moment you enter you are greeted by lush greenery, beautifully maintained gardens, and the sound of flowing fountains that immediately sets a refreshing mood. It truly feels like stepping into a calm and royal retreat away from the city‚Äôs hustle.

The highlight for me was the fountains which are designed in such a perfect way that they give the entire place a soothing vibe.
Walking around the marble pavilions, lotus pools, and flower beds, I felt the place was designed not just as a garden but as an experience for the senses. Every corner is aesthetic and picturesque, making it a paradise for photography lovers.
This place  is more than just a tourist attraction it reflects the royal lifestyle and the thoughtfulness with which it was built for the queen and her maids. Overall, it‚Äôs a must-visit spot in Udaipur for anyone who appreciates nature, history, and beauty blended together.

It's not that great place to visit if you seen some park with water fountains. For pics its good. I felt it's overrated. Its just my opinion.never hire guide here they are just to take pics for you nothing else.

This is a very beautiful garden, and it‚Äôs great for taking photos and videos. You can visit here, and the tickets are quite cheap‚ÄîI think just ‚Çπ30 per person. You can easily explore the entire garden in 1.5‚Äì2 hours, even if you stop frequently for photos and videos.

Saheliyon ki Bari is one of Udaipur‚Äôs most charming and well-maintained gardens, renowned for its lush greenery, beautiful fountains, marble pavilions, and delightful lotus pools.

History says it was built for the queen and her companions, the garden offers a tranquil escape from the city‚Äôs bustle. The atmosphere is serene, making it ideal for a leisurely stroll, photography, or simply relaxing in a picturesque setting.

Overall, it‚Äôs a must-visit in Udaipur for anyone interested in history, landscape beauty, or peaceful surroundings.

placeMetadata.name: City Palace

sources.snippet: The City Palace complex, constructed of granite and marble, is impressive for its flawless fusion of Chinese, European, and Medieval architecture. The complex‚Äôs several palaces are shown wonderfully behind the 100 feet high and 801 feet long facade that was expertly constructed on the Lake Pichola ridge. The 22 generations of Sisodia Rajputs constructed the City Palace complex, which is located at the height of 1,962 feet, over a protracted period of time beginning in the year 1559.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: The spectacular City Palace holds great historical importance as it once served as the administrative complex of the Maharanas of Udaipur. The construction of this beautiful palace was commissioned by Maharana Udai Singh II, and it was built for over 400 years by his successors. Standing tall in marble and granite, this building features a blend of Chinese, Medieval and European architectural styles.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Historical Places in Udaipur in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: 22 generations of the Mewar dynasty contributed to the City Palace over nearly 400 years. Begun in 1559, the main fa√ßademeasures 244 meters (800 feet) in length and over 30 meters (100 feet) in height. Elevensmaller palaces plus assorted gateways and courtyards make it Rajasthan‚Äôs largest palace ‚Äì no minor accomplishmentconsidering the competition from the region‚Äôs other dynasties.
sources.shortName: The Architecture of Udaipur, India‚Äôs White City

sources.snippet: The City Palace, perched atop a hill overlooking the lake, is a stunning blend of courtyards, pavilions, terraces, corridors, rooms, and hanging gardens. Enclosed by fortified walls, the main entrance is through the triple-arched Tripolia gate, featuring eight marble porticos. The palace is currently home to two luxurious hotels, a school and the popular City Palace Museum.
sources.shortName: Historical Places Near Udaipur : Most Famous Historical Places in Udaipur

placeMetadata.description: The palaces of 11 separate rulers sit together in this sprawling complex that was started in 1559.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The City Palace in Udaipur, Rajasthan is a sprawling complex that houses the palaces of 11 different rulers. It stands tall above Lake Pichola and offers stunning lakeside views. The palace boasts a facade that stretches almost 250 meters in length and rises over 30 meters in height. Visitors can enter through the Baripol Gate or the Tripolia Gate, both dating back to the 17th and 18th centuries.
placeMetadata.address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

Visiting this palace was like stepping into a living tapestry of India‚Äôs regal past. The sheer grandeur envelops you from the moment you enter, with architecture that gracefully marries elegance and legacy. Every corridor whispers stories of a bygone era, where artistry met opulence.
From the intricately carved facades to the richly adorned queen‚Äôs chambers, the palace stuns with its attention to detail. Personal belongings preserved through time add an intimate touch, bridging centuries in quiet reverence. The interiors are not just aesthetically beautiful‚Äîthey‚Äôre deeply immersive, offering a glimpse into royal life that feels almost tangible.
I highly recommend taking a guided tour‚Äînot only for the deeper historical insights but also for discovering the hidden corners perfect for photographs. Every nook holds a narrative, and with the right guide, those stories truly come alive.
If you‚Äôre visiting Udaipur, this palace is an absolute must. It‚Äôs more than a tourist attraction; it‚Äôs a soulful experience that lingers long after you've left.

placeMetadata.name: Jagdish Temple

sources.snippet: Jagdish Temple: Inspired by the Indo-Aryan style of architecture, this 3-storied temple comprises of carved pillars, decorated ceilings, painted walls and lush halls. The spire or the shikhar is a noticeable feature festooned with sculptures of dancers, horsemen, elephants and musicians. The entrance is flanked by 2 huge stone elephants and a stone slab with inscriptions.
sources.shortName: Architecture of Udaipur, Architectural Features of Udaipur

sources.snippet: Located just outside the Royal Palace, Jagdish Temple is one of the most popular historical places in Udaipur. Established in the 17th century, this mammoth Hindu is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is considered one of the most important shrines to Vishnu in the city. The Temple boasts of a flamboyant use of Indo-Aryan architectural style.
sources.shortName: 20 Historical Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: Jagdish Temple, built in 1651, is one of the best historical places to visit in Udaipur. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu, this temple was commissioned by Maharana Jagat Singh, who ruled the region from 1628 till 1653. This three-storied shrine features Indo-Aryan architecture with finely decorated ceilings and beautifully carved pillars.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Historical Places in Udaipur in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: This three-story temple is situated on a high platform and boasts wonderfully carved pillars, expansive, light-filled halls, and painted walls with bright decorations. Two enormous stone elephant sculptures have been placed at the entryway to greet guests. The stone slab at the entrance has writing etched on it.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

placeMetadata.description: Landmark Hindu temple featuring detailed carvings on the facade, plus statues & other art.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Jagdish Temple is a significant Hindu temple in Udaipur, dedicated to Lord Vishnu. The 16th-century structure showcases intricate carvings depicting ancient Hindu legends. Visitors can witness spiritual ceremonies conducted by Brahmins and devotees inside the temple. While entrance is free, donations are welcomed. Another notable temple in Udaipur is Mahakaleshwar Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva and located along the banks of Fateh Sagar Lake.
placeMetadata.address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

reviews.reviewText:
Nestled right in the vibrant heart of Udaipur, Jagdish Temple is more than just a place of worship ‚Äî it‚Äôs a masterpiece of devotion, architecture, and history. The moment you step through its grand entrance, you are greeted by an atmosphere of peace that stands in sharp contrast to the bustling city streets just outside.

The temple‚Äôs intricate carvings are simply mesmerizing, telling stories from ancient times with astonishing detail. Every pillar and corner showcases the remarkable craftsmanship of the artisans who built it nearly 400 years ago. As you climb the elegant marble steps, the energy shifts ‚Äî it‚Äôs almost as if time slows down to let you soak in the spiritual vibe.

The idol of Lord Vishnu (in the form of Jagannath) at the sanctum is stunning and radiates a serene, almost magnetic presence. Morning and evening aartis (prayer rituals) add an extra layer of magic to the experience, filling the temple with soulful chants and the fragrance of incense.

What truly sets Jagdish Temple apart is how seamlessly it blends into the life of Udaipur ‚Äî it's a living, breathing part of the city‚Äôs soul. Whether you're a devotee, a history lover, or simply an explorer seeking hidden gems, this temple promises a deeply enriching experience.

If you‚Äôre in Udaipur, a visit to Jagdish Temple isn‚Äôt just recommended ‚Äî it‚Äôs essential.

The Jagdish temple is a marvel - one climbs the steep steps to the initial courtyard and a lovely chap looks after your shoes for no more than 50R I think. We saw Ganesha first and walked round and then entered the Temple were devotees were chanting. The atmosphere was laid back and chill.

This famous temple offers a truly peaceful experience. Its ancient walls whisper tales of history, inviting you to step back in time and connect with a profound sense of serenity. A visit here is not just a sightseeing trip, but a journey for the soul, leaving you with a lasting sense of calm and reverence. Don't miss the opportunity to immerse yourself in its sacred atmosphere and rich heritage.

Jagdish Temple stands as the largest and one of the most beautiful temples in Udaipur, both architecturally and spiritually. It continues to hold immense significance for devotees and visitors to the city, remaining a testament to Udaipur‚Äôs rich royal and cultural heritage

The temple architecture is unmatched and glorified the richness of skills and devotion in ancient Indian civilization. I am proud to be a Hindu and also came to see this temple and witness  the glory of the mewar family and their contribution in dharma.
‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡§ø ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§É

We were honestly just stunned by the level of detail in this place‚Äîevery corner had something going on. Intricate carvings, beautifully done ceilings, and walls that felt like storybooks. The temple is a three-story structure, with the main shrine dedicated to Lord Vishnu. And while we don‚Äôt really know much about temples or the deeper meanings behind everything, we do know good architecture when we see it‚Äîand this one was something else.

The walls are painted with scenes from Hindu mythology‚ÄîRamayana, Mahabharata, all of it‚Äîand even without knowing every reference, it‚Äôs hard not to be impressed. Everything looked so carefully crafted, like someone had poured their entire soul into every detail.

We took over a hundred pictures, not even kidding. These are just a few clicks we decided to post, but trust us, we could‚Äôve made a whole photo album out of it. If you‚Äôre even a little into architecture or historical design, this place is a must-visit.

Also‚Äîmajor plus‚Äîit‚Äôs free. No entry fee, no fancy ticket. It‚Äôs a temple, open to all, which just adds to how cool and accessible it feels.

Only reason we‚Äôre giving it 4 stars instead of 5? The maintenance. Or rather, the lack of it. It‚Äôs honestly sad to see something this beautiful, something people actively worship, just not being taken care of. The structure deserves so much more respect. The government seriously needs to wake up and put some effort into preserving places like this. If you‚Äôre gonna call it cultural heritage, then treat it like one.

Jagdish Mandir, located in the heart of Udaipur at Jagdish chowk in the old city.

And this temple has became an identity of Udaipur be it for any tourist or for locals.

This temple has been built by "Maharana Jagat Singh I". This is an exceptional example of Rajput architecture.
Mandir ko banane ka maksad sirf bhakti nahi tha, balki Mewar ki shaan aur kala ki takat dikhana bhi tha.
The temple has 50 beautifully carved pillars which is just wow, what a wonder.

The evening aarti at Jagdish Mandir is truly a divine experience. The lamps, the sound of temple bells, and the chants of devotees create a powerful and peaceful atmosphere that you really have to feel for yourself.

The location of Jagdish Mandir is also super convenient it's right in the heart of Udaipur. You won‚Äôt just visit the temple, but also get the chance to explore some amazing nearby spots like
* Lake pichola (just a short walk or you can take auto/taxi, etc.)
* city palace (literally walking distance from the maintemple)
* Hathi pol & ashwini bazar (market famous for local art and handicraft)
* Gangaur ghat (a ghat which is a great place to explore from there you'll see the iconic city palace's view).

Plus, since the temple is located in the Old City, you‚Äôll find some really charming cafes in the narrow lanes perfect for grabbing a bite or coffee after sightseeing. The whole area is quite popular amongst the tourists, so you‚Äôll always see a lively vibe with travelers exploring the streets and having the best time.

Beautiful temple; even though we visited when there it was more likely to rain, it felt worth it! The architecture of the temple is stunning and the spirituality that was connected from all the visitors who sat inside the temple, singing hymns, is something worth mentioning. While the way to reach the place is definitely not elderly friendly, I would highly suggest taking an auto down (if up isn‚Äôt possible) to avoid further stress of the sloped walk up!

placeMetadata.name: Monsoon Palace

sources.snippet: Also known as Monsoon Palace, Sajjangarh Palace is located at a peak Bansdara Mountain as high as about 944 m above the sea level overlooking the famous Pichola Lake. This palace is also known Monsoon Palace because it was used as summer retreat for Mewar Kings and also as a Monsoon Palace, to watch the progress of Monsoon clouds. Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM (all days of the week)Entry Fee: INR 100 (Indians) and INR 335 (Foreigners), INR 100 (Vehicle Entry)Location: 11 Monsoon Colony, Sajjan Garh Road, Udaipur.
sources.shortName: 8 Beautiful Palaces in Udaipur to Visit (2024)

sources.snippet: Nestled amidst the rolling green Aravallis, Sajjangarh Palace served as Maharana Sajjan Singh‚Äôs palatial residence. Located at an elevation of over 3,000 feet above sea level, the Palace was frequented by the royal family during the monsoon season to witness the passing clouds, giving it the name of ‚ÄòMonsoon Palace‚Äô. The Palace is known for its exquisite architectural styles, with marble structures, domes, jharokha and well-kept gardens adding a regal beauty to the place.
sources.shortName: 20 Historical Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: Also known as Sajjangarh Palace, the Monsoon Palace is made of magnificent white marble, situated on a Bandara peak of the Aravalli range, which rises 3100 feet above sea level. The marble pillars that support the Fort‚Äôs foundation are intricately carved with floral and leafy designs. Lime mortar was used for plastering the palace walls.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: Sajjangarh Palace | #7 of 11 Best Historical Places in Udaipur. The 19 th-century Sajjangarh Palace is one of the most prominent historical places in the city of Udaipur. Built by Maharana Sajjan Singh in 1884, this palace was initially used as an astronomical centre but later, it was also used as a hunting lodge and monsoon palace.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Historical Places in Udaipur in 2024 (Photos)

reviews.reviewText:
The calm and view of sunset just touched my soul. This palace in udaipur truly made my day. I am silhouette lover and sunset is the soul for a silhouette. The Monsoon Palace is less about grandeur and more about atmospheric beauty‚Äîa place where history, nature, and romance come together under dramatic skies. While the structure itself is modest, the views are unforgettable‚Äîespecially during sunset or after the monsoon rains. It‚Äôs a must-visit for anyone seeking a tranquil, picture-perfect escape with a touch of royal nostalgia.

Absolutely breathtaking! The Monsoon Palace offers one of the most stunning panoramic views of Udaipur ‚Äì lakes, hills, and the city all spread out beautifully below. The view from the top is unforgettable, especially during the monsoon season when the greenery comes alive.

The drive up to the palace is equally scenic, with winding roads and lush landscapes that make the journey as enjoyable as the destination. Clouds drifting by, cool breeze, and light rain ‚Äì it‚Äôs truly magical.

If you‚Äôre in Udaipur during the rains, this is a must-visit spot. The combination of nature, views, and peaceful vibes make it a perfect escape.

I visited this place on public holiday. I had to wait for 1 hour to go up. If you have your own vehicle you can go up by your own vehicle by paying fees.
It cost 174 per head for persons entry and 120 for the trip up and down. If you have car you have to pay 338 and if you have bike you have to pay 72.
It‚Äôs a nice place we didn‚Äôt get sunset view because it was raining. Just one suggestion don‚Äôt go there on public holiday.

Beautiful Location, Especially During Monsoon But a Bit Overpriced..

Monsoon Palace is located on a hill surrounded by lush greenery, offering breathtaking views especially during the monsoon season, when its natural beauty multiplies. The road leading to the top is about 4 km long, steep, and winding, making it more suitable for experienced drivers.
Auto-rickshaws are not allowed, so visitors must either use their own vehicle or a government-approved cab. At the top, there's a small restaurant where you can enjoy coffee and snacks amidst scenic views and cool, refreshing winds.
From the palace, you get a panoramic view of Udaipur city, which is truly mesmerizing and peaceful. The palace also features a small wildlife exhibit and an interactive projector where you can see yourself amidst wild animals‚Äîa fun experience, though nothing extraordinary.
You should plan to spend at least an hour exploring the place. However, I felt the entry ticket (‚Çπ174 per person) is a bit overpriced for what‚Äôs offered. Also, personal car parking costs ‚Çπ338, which is quite expensive and should be reviewed by the authorities.

Overall, the place is worth visiting for nature lovers and photographers, especially during the rainy season but be prepared for the high charges.

I recently visited a beautiful hill station that features a stunning fort nestled among the clouds. It was monsoon season, so the entire place was wrapped in mist and rain, making it feel like something out of a dream. I forgot to carry an umbrella, but honestly, the beauty of the place made up for it. The cool breeze, the soft drizzle, and the breathtaking views were just unforgettable.

If you're someone who enjoys hiking, this destination is definitely worth adding to your list. The trails are scenic, peaceful, and offer some incredible photo opportunities.

One word of advice: if you're not a regular or confident driver, I highly recommend hiring a local driver. The roads leading up to the hill station are quite steep, with sharp turns and narrow stretches that can be challenging to navigate, especially in the rain. Local drivers are experienced with these routes and will make your journey safer and more comfortable.

Overall, it was a magical trip, and I‚Äôd absolutely go back‚Äîjust with an umbrella next time!

A must visit place in Udaipur. You can see the complete city from the top and the view of both the lakes is very surreal and beautiful. When I went there, it was raining which made my visit more beautiful. You have to buy the entry ticket and then you can go by the taxis provided or by your own vehicle too.

placeMetadata.name: Lake Pichola

sources.snippet: Maharana Udai Singh was so mesmerized by the alluring lake that he founded the city of Udaipur right there on its shores. By constructing a dam on the lake‚Äôs edge, Maharana Udai Singh is credited with significantly increasing the lake. The lake‚Äôs environs thereafter saw the development of a number of islands, palaces, temples, residences, and bathing ghats over time, enhancing its allure.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: The foundation of this city follows as per the legend when Maharana Udai Singh met a holy man overlooking Lake Pichola and he blessed and advised him to build a palace near the fertile valley watered by lake within the mountains. placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Lake Pichola, an artificial freshwater lake in Udaipur, Rajasthan, offers boat rides and is home to several islands with palaces. Built in 1362, it was initially intended to meet the city's water and irrigation needs. The lake has four islands including Arsi villa & Jag Niwas, which houses a small palace and a sanctuary for bird watching.
placeMetadata.address: Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001

reviews.reviewText:
Lake Pichola in Udaipur feels like something out of a dream. The beauty of the lake, with the mountains and palaces around it, is just magical. You can enter from the City Palace side, where you need to buy a ticket for the boat ride. The boat ride is one of the best experiences you can have ‚Äî the calm water, the cool breeze, and the amazing view of old buildings and the sunset make it unforgettable.

The boat also stops at Jag Mandir, which is a beautiful place to walk around and click some great pictures. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was the food at Jag Mandir ‚Äî it‚Äôs way too expensive. But apart from that, Lake Pichola is truly a place that feels like another world. A must-visit when you are in Udaipur!
One of my favourite place. ‚ù§Ô∏è beautiful lakes surroundings hills. City palace mesmerizing view .I was staying nearby hotel and enjoyed a lot

Sunset here feels like a dream with the water reflecting the changing colors of the sky

Built in the 14th century, this lake surrounds beautiful palaces that seem to float. Boat rides are amazing, but ticket prices could be more affordable

Absolutely stunning place! The views are magical, especially during sunset. The boat ride is a must-do ‚Äî calm waters, beautiful palaces, and peaceful vibes all around. Perfect spot for couples, solo travelers, and photography lovers. Udaipur trip is incomplete without visiting Lake Pichola!

Lake Pichola is a beautiful spot in Udaipur with stunning views, boat rides, and historic palaces like Jag Mandir and Jag Niwas. Enjoy scenic views, sunsets, and peaceful moments. Visit early or late to avoid crowds. A must-visit for its beauty and cultural significance.
The lake's tranquil atmosphere and majestic surroundings make it perfect for relaxation. Take a romantic boat ride or simply sit back and soak in the beauty. Don't miss the breathtaking sunsets and the opportunity to capture stunning photographs. Whether you're looking for peace, romance, or adventure, Lake Pichola has something for everyone.

Lake Pichola is hands down one of the most magical spots in Udaipur. Surrounded by stunning architecture like the City Palace, Jag Mandir, and the Lake Palace, it offers a picture-perfect view that feels straight out of a postcard. I spent quite some time just walking along the lakefront near the City Palace, and every angle felt like it was made to be photographed.

What makes the lake so special is the way it reflects the colors of the sky‚Äîespecially during sunrise and sunset. The changing hues, combined with the calm water and the majestic palaces floating in the middle, create an almost dream-like atmosphere. I took a boat ride during sunset, and it was honestly the best decision. Passing by Jag Mandir with the City Palace glowing in the background was just unforgettable.There‚Äôs a certain peace to being by Lake Pichola. Even with tourists around, it doesn‚Äôt feel chaotic. The breeze, the soft sounds of water, and the views make it a perfect spot to slow down and just take it all in.

If you‚Äôre in Udaipur, don‚Äôt miss this. Whether you‚Äôre exploring the palaces nearby or just enjoying a quiet evening by the ghats, Lake Pichola truly captures the soul of the city.

Lake Pichola is the crown jewel of Udaipur ‚Äî a picturesque, man-made freshwater lake that feels like a dream. Built in 1362 AD, it‚Äôs surrounded by palaces, temples, ghats, and scenic hills, making it one of the most romantic and iconic places in Rajasthan.

---

üåä Highlights:

Boat Ride Experience: The boat ride (especially at sunset) is magical. It offers stunning views of the City Palace, Jag Mandir, Taj Lake Palace, and the surrounding hills.

Palaces on the Water:

Jag Mandir ‚Äì open for visitors with a royal feel.

Lake Palace (Taj Hotel) ‚Äì visible from the boat, known for its heritage charm.

Scenic Surroundings: Aravalli hills, old havelis, and historic ghats like Gangaur Ghat add to the lake‚Äôs timeless beauty.

Best Views: Ambrai Ghat, Lal Ghat, City Palace, and from rooftop caf√©s.

---

‚úÖ Pros:

Mesmerizing views, especially during sunrise and sunset.

Peaceful ambiance ideal for couples, families, and photographers.

Boat ride is well-organized and gives a full experience.

Lots of scenic spots nearby (ghats, temples, caf√©s).

---

‚ùå Cons:

Boat rides can be a bit pricey (‚Çπ400‚Äì‚Çπ800 depending on type and time).

Crowded during weekends and peak tourist season.

Limited public seating around the lake.

---

üí° Tips:

Sunset boat ride is the best ‚Äî golden light + cool breeze.

Visit Ambrai Ghat for peaceful lake views and evening photography.

If on a budget, skip the palace entry and just enjoy the ghats.

---

‚≠ê Final Verdict:

Lake Pichola is the soul of Udaipur ‚Äî calm, romantic, and regal. Whether you're on a boat gliding over the water or sipping coffee at a lakeside caf√©, this lake promises an unforgettable experience. A must-visit and truly a 5-star destination!

During our Udaipur trip, we planned to enjoy boating at Lake Pichola, but since it was a holiday, the place was extremely crowded. There were long queues, and even with two separate lines (possibly for ticket types), the wait was too much ‚Äî so we ended up skipping the boat ride.

Still, we didn‚Äôt want to miss the iconic sunset view, and honestly, it didn‚Äôt disappoint. The golden hour reflecting off the water with views of the City Palace, Jag Mandir, and Taj Lake Palace in the middle of the lake was absolutely magical.

Boating prices vary:
‚Ä¢ We selected ‚Çπ200 one, because there was long wait in other slots.

Around ‚Çπ400‚Äì‚Çπ600 per person for regular boat rides

‚Çπ800‚Äì‚Çπ1000 for sunset or evening slots (private boats cost more)

Also, there's a man who has a telescope so you can see the view which charges ‚Çπ20 to ‚Çπ50 per person. There are a lot many snacks counters where you can buy but while entering the boat they don't allow the food, so make sure to avoid carrying any.

If you really want to experience it without the rush, try visiting on a weekday or early morning. Even without boating, just sitting by the lake and soaking in the views is worth it.

sources.snippet: Most cities in Rajasthan have an iconic clock tower at the heart of the city, and Udaipur is no different. The clock tower, or ghanta ghar as it is locally known, was built by the royal family of Mewar in the year 1887. The tower serves as an important landmark in the city.

Visitors can also find colorful tapestries, decorated idols of Hindu deities, copperwares, metal assortments, and earthenware.

Chowmukha was built by Rana Sangram Singhji II during 1710-34.

In the center of the Zenana Mahal there is an open courtyard named Lakshmi Chowk.

placeMetadata.name: City palace

sources.snippet: Built over a span of 400 years, City Palace is one of Udaipur‚Äôs most marvelous structures. Flanked by Lake Pichola, the palace is among the most beautiful historical places in Udaipur. The Palace is known for its architectural styles and designs; the interiors of the palace is home to several other structures as well, such as the Suraj Gokhda Mor-chowk Dilkhush Mahal,Surya Chopar, Sheesh Mahal, and Moti Mahal.

Commissioned by Maharana Udai Singh, it took over 300 years to fully realize this royal residence's grandeur.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Udaipur, often referred to as the 'City of Lakes', is a treasure trove of architectural marvels that reflect its rich history and vibrant culture. From the majestic City Palace, which showcases a blend of Rajasthani and European styles, to the serene Sajjangarh Monsoon Palace perched high on a hill, the city offers a stunning array of structures that tell the story of its royal past. Each corner of Udaipur is adorned with intricate carvings and unique designs, making it a paradise for architecture enthusiasts and casual visitors alike.

As you wander through the streets of Udaipur, you'll discover a mix of traditional and contemporary architecture that captures the essence of this enchanting city. Not only do the historic palaces and temples stand tall, but modern architectural firms like Priyanka Arjun and Associates and VRA Architects are also making their mark with innovative designs that prioritize sustainability and functionality. Whether you're exploring the ornate details of Jagdish Temple or admiring the luxurious Jagmandir Island Palace, Udaipur's architectural landscape invites you to delve deeper into its beauty and charm. So grab your camera and get ready to explore the best of Udaipur's architecture!

placeMetadata.name: Lake Pichola

sources.snippet: Built in 1362 AD, in all likelihood by a banjara tribesman, Lake Pichola today is a famous image of Udaipur. Estimating almost 4 Km long and 3 Km in width, the lake is an unquestionable requirement spot to visit in Udaipur. A heap of castles, sanctuaries, imperial quarters and ghats and chabutaras have been created around the lake and on its few islands throughout the long term.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places to Visit in Udaipur | City of Lakes

sources.snippet: The four-kilometer-long stunning beauty is often compared to Venice in the West. One of the best Udaipur tourist places to soak in the natural beauty ‚Äì do you know that it and other lakes are the results of the far-sightedness of the Maharanas?. Yes, each lake including Lake Pichola is a man-made lake dugout as a water reservoir in the arid city of Rajasthan.
sources.shortName: 30 Best Places to Visit in and Near Udaipur for an unforgettable experience

sources.snippet: Constructed in 1362 AD, most likely by a banjara tribesman, Lake Pichola today is an iconic symbol of Udaipur. Measuring nearly 4 Km in length and 3 Km in width, the lake is a must-see place to visit in Udaipur. A myriad of palaces, temples, royal quarters and ghats and chabutaras have been developed around the lake and on its several islands over the years.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: Indeed, Lake Pichola is among some of the most gorgeous lakes in the city of Udaipur. The waters of Prayaga are calm and are hemmed in by magnificent mountains, prestigious palaces, temples and bathing places called the ghats. Taking a boat ride in this lake particularly at evening, allow having a lookout of the City Palace as well as the Lake Palace.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: Lake Pichola was built in 1362 AD, by a Banjara tribesman, and is now a classic symbol of Udaipur. This lake, which is over 4 kilometres long and 3 kilometres wide, is a must-see attraction when you are in Udaipur. Over the years, a plethora of palaces, temples, royal apartments, ghats, and chabutaras have sprouted up around the lake.
sources.shortName: 8 Places Udaipur is Famous for to Visit in Daytime ‚Äì UdaipurBlog

sources.snippet: From the historic City Palace to the tranquil Lake Pichola, guests can explore the rich cultural heritage of Udaipur without straying far from the comfort of their luxurious accommodations.
sources.shortName: Best Villa in Udaipur, Luxury Villa in Udaipur

sources.snippet: Picholi was the name of a village that lent its name to the lake. The islands of Jagniwas and Jagmandir are housed in this lake. Along the eastern banks of the lake lies the City Palace.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Udaipur, Tourist Places, Points of Interest

sources.snippet: Surrounded by majestic temples and palaces in the heart of the city, the captivating vistas that this enchanting man-made lake offers are a sight to behold!
sources.shortName: Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

placeMetadata.description: Boat rides are offered on this artificial freshwater lake featuring islands with palaces.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Lake Pichola, an artificial freshwater lake in Udaipur, Rajasthan, offers boat rides and is home to several islands with palaces. Built in 1362, it was initially intended to meet the city's water and irrigation needs. The lake has four islands including Arsi villa & Jag Niwas, which houses a small palace and a sanctuary for bird watching.
placeMetadata.address: Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001

reviews.reviewText:
Lake Pichola in Udaipur feels like something out of a dream. The beauty of the lake, with the mountains and palaces around it, is just magical. You can enter from the City Palace side, where you need to buy a ticket for the boat ride. The boat ride is one of the best experiences you can have ‚Äî the calm water, the cool breeze, and the amazing view of old buildings and the sunset make it unforgettable.

The boat also stops at Jag Mandir, which is a beautiful place to walk around and click some great pictures. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was the food at Jag Mandir ‚Äî it‚Äôs way too expensive. But apart from that, Lake Pichola is truly a place that feels like another world. A must-visit when you are in Udaipur!
One of my favourite place. ‚ù§Ô∏è beautiful lakes surroundings hills. City palace mesmerizing view .I was staying nearby hotel and enjoyed a lot

Sunset here feels like a dream with the water reflecting the changing colors of the sky

Built in the 14th century, this lake surrounds beautiful palaces that seem to float. Boat rides are amazing, but ticket prices could be more affordable

Absolutely stunning place! The views are magical, especially during sunset. The boat ride is a must-do ‚Äî calm waters, beautiful palaces, and peaceful vibes all around. Perfect spot for couples, solo travelers, and photography lovers. Udaipur trip is incomplete without visiting Lake Pichola!

Lake Pichola is a beautiful spot in Udaipur with stunning views, boat rides, and historic palaces like Jag Mandir and Jag Niwas. Enjoy scenic views, sunsets, and peaceful moments. Visit early or late to avoid crowds. A must-visit for its beauty and cultural significance.
The lake's tranquil atmosphere and majestic surroundings make it perfect for relaxation. Take a romantic boat ride or simply sit back and soak in the beauty. Don't miss the breathtaking sunsets and the opportunity to capture stunning photographs. Whether you're looking for peace, romance, or adventure, Lake Pichola has something for everyone.

Lake Pichola is hands down one of the most magical spots in Udaipur. Surrounded by stunning architecture like the City Palace, Jag Mandir, and the Lake Palace, it offers a picture-perfect view that feels straight out of a postcard. I spent quite some time just walking along the lakefront near the City Palace, and every angle felt like it was made to be photographed.

What makes the lake so special is the way it reflects the colors of the sky‚Äîespecially during sunrise and sunset. The changing hues, combined with the calm water and the majestic palaces floating in the middle, create an almost dream-like atmosphere. I took a boat ride during sunset, and it was honestly the best decision. Passing by Jag Mandir with the City Palace glowing in the background was just unforgettable.There‚Äôs a certain peace to being by Lake Pichola. Even with tourists around, it doesn‚Äôt feel chaotic. The breeze, the soft sounds of water, and the views make it a perfect spot to slow down and just take it all in.

If you‚Äôre in Udaipur, don‚Äôt miss this. Whether you‚Äôre exploring the palaces nearby or just enjoying a quiet evening by the ghats, Lake Pichola truly captures the soul of the city.

Lake Pichola is the crown jewel of Udaipur ‚Äî a picturesque, man-made freshwater lake that feels like a dream. Built in 1362 AD, it‚Äôs surrounded by palaces, temples, ghats, and scenic hills, making it one of the most romantic and iconic places in Rajasthan.

---

üåä Highlights:

Boat Ride Experience: The boat ride (especially at sunset) is magical. It offers stunning views of the City Palace, Jag Mandir, Taj Lake Palace, and the surrounding hills.

Palaces on the Water:

Jag Mandir ‚Äì open for visitors with a royal feel.

Lake Palace (Taj Hotel) ‚Äì visible from the boat, known for its heritage charm.

Scenic Surroundings: Aravalli hills, old havelis, and historic ghats like Gangaur Ghat add to the lake‚Äôs timeless beauty.

Best Views: Ambrai Ghat, Lal Ghat, City Palace, and from rooftop caf√©s.

---

‚úÖ Pros:

Mesmerizing views, especially during sunrise and sunset.

Peaceful ambiance ideal for couples, families, and photographers.

Boat ride is well-organized and gives a full experience.

Lots of scenic spots nearby (ghats, temples, caf√©s).

---

‚ùå Cons:

Boat rides can be a bit pricey (‚Çπ400‚Äì‚Çπ800 depending on type and time).

Crowded during weekends and peak tourist season.

Limited public seating around the lake.

---

üí° Tips:

Sunset boat ride is the best ‚Äî golden light + cool breeze.

Visit Ambrai Ghat for peaceful lake views and evening photography.

If on a budget, skip the palace entry and just enjoy the ghats.

---

‚≠ê Final Verdict:

Lake Pichola is the soul of Udaipur ‚Äî calm, romantic, and regal. Whether you're on a boat gliding over the water or sipping coffee at a lakeside caf√©, this lake promises an unforgettable experience. A must-visit and truly a 5-star destination!

During our Udaipur trip, we planned to enjoy boating at Lake Pichola, but since it was a holiday, the place was extremely crowded. There were long queues, and even with two separate lines (possibly for ticket types), the wait was too much ‚Äî so we ended up skipping the boat ride.

Still, we didn‚Äôt want to miss the iconic sunset view, and honestly, it didn‚Äôt disappoint. The golden hour reflecting off the water with views of the City Palace, Jag Mandir, and Taj Lake Palace in the middle of the lake was absolutely magical.

Boating prices vary:
‚Ä¢ We selected ‚Çπ200 one, because there was long wait in other slots.

Around ‚Çπ400‚Äì‚Çπ600 per person for regular boat rides

‚Çπ800‚Äì‚Çπ1000 for sunset or evening slots (private boats cost more)

Also, there's a man who has a telescope so you can see the view which charges ‚Çπ20 to ‚Çπ50 per person. There are a lot many snacks counters where you can buy but while entering the boat they don't allow the food, so make sure to avoid carrying any.

If you really want to experience it without the rush, try visiting on a weekday or early morning. Even without boating, just sitting by the lake and soaking in the views is worth it.

placeMetadata.name: Monsoon Palace

sources.snippet: Sajjangarh Palace or The Monsoon Palace is positioned on a hilltop and offers amazing views of Fateh Sagar Lake and the surrounding Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary. This castle-like building is straight out of a fairy tale and is a perfect example of the opulence of the Rajput rulers ‚Äì the palace was made just to be able to enjoy watching monsoon clouds gather promisingly in the sky!. Built by Maharana Sajjan Singh in 1884, the Sajjangarh Palace should be on your list of places to visit in Udaipur mainly for the spectacular panoramic views of Udaipur city and its stunning lakes, mountains and palaces.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: The Sajjangarh Palace also known as the Monsoon Palace is located on a pinnacle with spectacular views of Fateh Sagar Lake and the Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary. This castle-like structure is straight out of a fairy tale and is a superb example of Rajput majesty ‚Äì the palace was built solely to enjoy watching clouds that gather in the sky during the monsoon season!. The Sajjangarh Palace, built by Maharana Sajjan Singh in 1884, should be on your list of sites to see in Udaipur, mostly for the phenomenal panoramic view of the city and its beautiful lakes, mountains, and castles.
sources.shortName: 8 Places Udaipur is Famous for to Visit in Daytime ‚Äì UdaipurBlog

sources.snippet: Also known as Monsoon Palace, Sajjangarh Palace is located at a peak Bansdara Mountain as high as about 944 m above the sea level overlooking the famous Pichola Lake. This palace is also known Monsoon Palace because it was used as summer retreat for Mewar Kings and also as a Monsoon Palace, to watch the progress of Monsoon clouds. Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM (all days of the week)Entry Fee: INR 100 (Indians) and INR 335 (Foreigners), INR 100 (Vehicle Entry)Location: 11 Monsoon Colony, Sajjan Garh Road, Udaipur.
sources.shortName: 8 Beautiful Palaces in Udaipur to Visit (2024)

sources.snippet: Nestled atop the Aravalli hills, the Sajjangarh Palace majestically overlooks the shimmering waters of Lake Fateh Sagar and Udaipur‚Äôs iconic City Palace. Its grandeur, discernible even from the city‚Äôs heart, paints a captivating silhouette against the sky, making it a haven for photography enthusiasts. The palace‚Äôs allure was further magnified when it became a filming location for the 1983 James Bond film, ‚ÄúOctopussy.
sources.shortName: Palaces of Udaipur - Treasures of a bygone era

sources.snippet: Formerly known as the Sajjangarh Palace, the Monsoon Palace is a hilltop residence that offers a spectacular view of palaces, lakes and the surrounding countryside. As the name suggests, this palace was built to watch the progress of the monsoon clouds. Located in the Aravalli Hills, the palace glows with a golden orange colour in the evening and proves to a perfect sunset gazing spot.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Forts & Palaces In Udaipur - A Handpicked List

reviews.reviewText:
The calm and view of sunset just touched my soul. This palace in udaipur truly made my day. I am silhouette lover and sunset is the soul for a silhouette. This palace is totally made for the sunset view. I visited here in march end week and I missed the sunset view from the karni mata mandir. But caught the full üåá sunset view at this palace.

The price can be feel bit high but truly worth it. Here, you can go by your own vehicle or by buying ticket for car service that will provide take and drop service.

Note: If you took their vehicle service don't lost the ticket as the contact details are written on the ticket only. So , if you missed the last car while enjoying till bit late. So you can contact them and they will come to pick you. But try to come back till 6pm last after that you will not get auto or any online service as this place is far from local areas.

The Monsoon Palace is less about grandeur and more about atmospheric beauty‚Äîa place where history, nature, and romance come together under dramatic skies. While the structure itself is modest, the views are unforgettable‚Äîespecially during sunset or after the monsoon rains. It‚Äôs a must-visit for anyone seeking a tranquil, picture-perfect escape with a touch of royal nostalgia.

Absolutely breathtaking! The Monsoon Palace offers one of the most stunning panoramic views of Udaipur ‚Äì lakes, hills, and the city all spread out beautifully below. The view from the top is unforgettable, especially during the monsoon season when the greenery comes alive.

The drive up to the palace is equally scenic, with winding roads and lush landscapes that make the journey as enjoyable as the destination. Clouds drifting by, cool breeze, and light rain ‚Äì it‚Äôs truly magical.

If you‚Äôre in Udaipur during the rains, this is a must-visit spot. The combination of nature, views, and peaceful vibes make it a perfect escape.

I visited this place on public holiday. I had to wait for 1 hour to go up. If you have your own vehicle you can go up by your own vehicle by paying fees.
It cost 174 per head for persons entry and 120 for the trip up and down. If you have car you have to pay 338 and if you have bike you have to pay 72.
It‚Äôs a nice place we didn‚Äôt get sunset view because it was raining. Just one suggestion don‚Äôt go there on public holiday.

Beautiful Location, Especially During Monsoon But a Bit Overpriced..

Monsoon Palace is located on a hill surrounded by lush greenery, offering breathtaking views especially during the monsoon season, when its natural beauty multiplies. The road leading to the top is about 4 km long, steep, and winding, making it more suitable for experienced drivers.
Auto-rickshaws are not allowed, so visitors must either use their own vehicle or a government-approved cab. At the top, there's a small restaurant where you can enjoy coffee and snacks amidst scenic views and cool, refreshing winds.
From the palace, you get a panoramic view of Udaipur city, which is truly mesmerizing and peaceful. The palace also features a small wildlife exhibit and an interactive projector where you can see yourself amidst wild animals‚Äîa fun experience, though nothing extraordinary.
You should plan to spend at least an hour exploring the place. However, I felt the entry ticket (‚Çπ174 per person) is a bit overpriced for what‚Äôs offered. Also, personal car parking costs ‚Çπ338, which is quite expensive and should be reviewed by the authorities.

Overall, the place is worth visiting for nature lovers and photographers, especially during the rainy season but be prepared for the high charges.

Excellent and thrilling experience.
Going up the hill through scooter/bike gives additional flavor to your journey .
If you want to enjoy beautiful nature üòò you can enjoy rich and dense forest.
Sharing taxi tickets available at the entry .
120/- per person for up and down.
One should also has to purchase entry tickets.

I recently visited a beautiful hill station that features a stunning fort nestled among the clouds. It was monsoon season, so the entire place was wrapped in mist and rain, making it feel like something out of a dream. I forgot to carry an umbrella, but honestly, the beauty of the place made up for it. The cool breeze, the soft drizzle, and the breathtaking views were just unforgettable.

If you're someone who enjoys hiking, this destination is definitely worth adding to your list. The trails are scenic, peaceful, and offer some incredible photo opportunities.

One word of advice: if you're not a regular or confident driver, I highly recommend hiring a local driver. The roads leading up to the hill station are quite steep, with sharp turns and narrow stretches that can be challenging to navigate, especially in the rain. Local drivers are experienced with these routes and will make your journey safer and more comfortable.

Overall, it was a magical trip, and I‚Äôd absolutely go back‚Äîjust with an umbrella next time!

A must visit place in Udaipur. You can see the complete city from the top and the view of both the lakes is very surreal and beautiful. When I went there, it was raining which made my visit more beautiful. You have to buy the entry ticket and then you can go by the taxis provided or by your own vehicle too.

City Palace in Udaipur is a masterpiece of regal architecture that exudes luxury at every corner. The sheer grandeur of the place, along with its rich history, felt like royalty. Visiting this palace was like stepping into a living tapestry of India‚Äôs regal past. The sheer grandeur envelops you from the moment you enter, with architecture that gracefully marries elegance and legacy. Every corridor whispers stories of a bygone era, where artistry met opulence.
From the intricately carved facades to the richly adorned queen‚Äôs chambers, the palace stuns with its attention to detail. Personal belongings preserved through time add an intimate touch, bridging centuries in quiet reverence. The interiors are not just aesthetically beautiful‚Äîthey‚Äôre deeply immersive, offering a glimpse into royal life that feels almost tangible.
I highly recommend taking a guided tour‚Äînot only for the deeper historical insights but also for discovering the hidden corners perfect for photographs. Every nook holds a narrative, and with the right guide, those stories truly come alive.
If you‚Äôre visiting Udaipur, this palace is an absolute must. It‚Äôs more than a tourist attraction; it‚Äôs a soulful experience that lingers long after you've left.

A place the city is known for. It beautifully shows Indian art, culture, and royal history. The rooms inside are full of colours, mirrors, and traditional designs that look straight out of a painting. Each corner has something unique to see. The 16th-century structure showcases intricate carvings depicting ancient Hindu legends. Visitors can witness spiritual ceremonies conducted by Brahmins and devotees inside the temple. While entrance is free, donations are welcomed. Another notable temple in Udaipur is Mahakaleshwar Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva and located along the banks of Fateh Sagar Lake.

reviews.reviewText:
Nestled right in the vibrant heart of Udaipur, Jagdish Temple is more than just a place of worship ‚Äî it‚Äôs a masterpiece of devotion, architecture, and history. The moment you step through its grand entrance, you are greeted by an atmosphere of peace that stands in sharp contrast to the bustling city streets just outside.

The temple‚Äôs intricate carvings are simply mesmerizing, telling stories from ancient times with astonishing detail. Every pillar and corner showcases the remarkable craftsmanship of the artisans who built it nearly 400 years ago. As you climb the elegant marble steps, the energy shifts ‚Äî it‚Äôs almost as if time slows down to let you soak in the spiritual vibe.

The idol of Lord Vishnu (in the form of Jagannath) at the sanctum is stunning and radiates a serene, almost magnetic presence. Morning and evening aartis (prayer rituals) add an extra layer of magic to the experience, filling the temple with soulful chants and the fragrance of incense.

What truly sets Jagdish Temple apart is how seamlessly it blends into the life of Udaipur ‚Äî it's a living, breathing part of the city‚Äôs soul. Whether you're a devotee, a history lover, or simply an explorer seeking hidden gems, this temple promises a deeply enriching experience.

If you‚Äôre in Udaipur, a visit to Jagdish Temple isn‚Äôt just recommended ‚Äî it‚Äôs essential.

The Jagdish temple is a marvel - one climbs the steep steps to the initial courtyard and a lovely chap looks after your shoes for no more than 50R I think. We saw Ganesha first and walked round and then entered the Temple were devotees were chanting. The atmosphere was laid back and chill.

This famous temple offers a truly peaceful experience. Its ancient walls whisper tales of history, inviting you to step back in time and connect with a profound sense of serenity. A visit here is not just a sightseeing trip, but a journey for the soul, leaving you with a lasting sense of calm and reverence. Don't miss the opportunity to immerse yourself in its sacred atmosphere and rich heritage.

Jagdish Temple stands as the largest and one of the most beautiful temples in Udaipur, both architecturally and spiritually. It continues to hold immense significance for devotees and visitors to the city, remaining a testament to Udaipur‚Äôs rich royal and cultural heritage

The temple architecture is unmatched and glorified the richness of skills and devotion in ancient Indian civilization. I am proud to be a Hindu and also came to see this temple and witness  the glory of the mewar family and their contribution in dharma.
‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡§ø ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§É

We were honestly just stunned by the level of detail in this place‚Äîevery corner had something going on. Intricate carvings, beautifully done ceilings, and walls that felt like storybooks. The temple is a three-story structure, with the main shrine dedicated to Lord Vishnu. And while we don‚Äôt really know much about temples or the deeper meanings behind everything, we do know good architecture when we see it‚Äîand this one was something else.

The walls are painted with scenes from Hindu mythology‚ÄîRamayana, Mahabharata, all of it‚Äîand even without knowing every reference, it‚Äôs hard not to be impressed. Everything looked so carefully crafted, like someone had poured their entire soul into every detail.

We took over a hundred pictures, not even kidding. These are just a few clicks we decided to post, but trust us, we could‚Äôve made a whole photo album out of it. If you‚Äôre even a little into architecture or historical design, this place is a must-visit.

Also‚Äîmajor plus‚Äîit‚Äôs free. No entry fee, no fancy ticket. It‚Äôs a temple, open to all, which just adds to how cool and accessible it feels.

Only reason we‚Äôre giving it 4 stars instead of 5? The maintenance. Or rather, the lack of it. It‚Äôs honestly sad to see something this beautiful, something people actively worship, just not being taken care of. The structure deserves so much more respect. The government seriously needs to wake up and put some effort into preserving places like this. If you‚Äôre gonna call it cultural heritage, then treat it like one.

Jagdish Mandir, located in the heart of Udaipur at Jagdish chowk in the old city.

And this temple has became an identity of Udaipur be it for any tourist or for locals.

This temple has been built by "Maharana Jagat Singh I". This is an exceptional example of Rajput architecture.
Mandir ko banane ka maksad sirf bhakti nahi tha, balki Mewar ki shaan aur kala ki takat dikhana bhi tha.
The temple has 50 beautifully carved pillars which is just wow, what a wonder.

The evening aarti at Jagdish Mandir is truly a divine experience. The lamps, the sound of temple bells, and the chants of devotees create a powerful and peaceful atmosphere that you really have to feel for yourself.

The location of Jagdish Mandir is also super convenient it's right in the heart of Udaipur. You won‚Äôt just visit the temple, but also get the chance to explore some amazing nearby spots like
* Lake pichola (just a short walk or you can take auto/taxi, etc.)
* city palace (literally walking distance from the maintemple)
* Hathi pol & ashwini bazar (market famous for local art and handicraft)
* Gangaur ghat (a ghat which is a great place to explore from there you'll see the iconic city palace's view).

Plus, since the temple is located in the Old City, you‚Äôll find some really charming cafes in the narrow lanes perfect for grabbing a bite or coffee after sightseeing. The whole area is quite popular amongst the tourists, so you‚Äôll always see a lively vibe with travelers exploring the streets and having the best time.

Beautiful temple; even though we visited when there it was more likely to rain, it felt worth it! The architecture of the temple is stunning and the spirituality that was connected from all the visitors who sat inside the temple, singing hymns, is something worth mentioning. While the way to reach the place is definitely not elderly friendly, I would highly suggest taking an auto down (if up isn‚Äôt possible) to avoid further stress of the sloped walk up!

reviews.reviewText:
This is a must-visit place! The experience is absolutely worth the money. Make sure to buy your tickets online to secure your spot.

Bagore Ki Haveli is one of the most memorable places I visited in Udaipur. Located right near Gangaur Ghat and overlooking Lake Pichola, it gives off a very authentic Rajasthani vibe. The haveli itself is beautifully restored and has over 100 rooms filled with old photographs, costumes, weapons, royal artifacts, and some really intricate mirror and glass work.The best part for me was the evening cultural show (Dharohar) held in the courtyard‚Äîabsolutely worth attending! Traditional Rajasthani folk dances, puppetry, and live music performances made it super lively and entertaining. The dancers were amazing, especially the woman who balanced multiple pots on her head‚Äîso talented! Pro tip: reach at least 30‚Äì45 minutes early to get front row seats because it gets crowded fast.I also enjoyed exploring the different parts of the haveli, like the royal bedroom, women‚Äôs quarters, and balconies with stunning views of the lake. The ticket prices are very reasonable (‚Çπ60 for Indians + ‚Çπ150 camera fee, approx), and it feels like a great value for the experience.It‚Äôs located in the Old City, so the streets are narrow, and it‚Äôs better to walk or take a tuk-tuk instead of driving. You can easily visit Jagdish Temple or take a boat ride nearby after this. Bagore Ki Haveli is a must-visit if you‚Äôre in Udaipur and love history, culture, or just want to see something different and real.

Bagore Ki Haveli, a majestic palace at Gangaur Ghat, is a must-visit places. This architectural gem, once a royal residence,and ornate balconies with the serene lake and surrounding hills.
The haveli's courtyard transformed into an open-air amphitheatre, and immerse yourself in the world of Rajasthani artistry. Renowned dance and musical performances come alive within these historic walls, offering a captivating glimpse into the region's rich artistic traditions.

This is truly one of the must-visit places in Udaipur. The ticket is priced at ‚Çπ125 per person, and if you wish to use your phone camera to take photos or record videos, there‚Äôs an additional ‚Çπ125 charge. I highly recommend paying this extra amount ‚Äî it‚Äôs a small way to show respect for the artists and the incredible effort put into preserving and showcasing Rajasthan's rich cultural heritage.

The cultural show runs from 7 PM to 8 PM, and tickets are available starting at 6 PM. I suggest entering the museum by 6:30 PM to grab a front-row seat.

Overall, Bagore Ki Haveli is a place you shouldn‚Äôt miss, especially the cultural performance ‚Äî it‚Äôs absolutely worth it.

Bagore Ki Haveli, situated on the banks of Lake Pichola near Gangaur Ghat in Udaipur, is a splendid 18th-century mansion that offers a rich glimpse into Rajasthan‚Äôs royal lifestyle and cultural heritage. Built by Amir Chand Badwa, the Prime Minister of Mewar, this haveli is now a well-preserved museum and cultural hub that attracts both history enthusiasts and art lovers.

The architecture of Bagore Ki Haveli is a fine example of traditional Mewari style, featuring intricately carved jharokhas, expansive courtyards, decorative archways, and more than 100 rooms. Each room showcases authentic royal artifacts such as costumes, weapons, jewelry, and musical instruments, giving visitors a true taste of regal Rajasthani life. The Queen‚Äôs Chamber, with its beautifully colored glass windows and mirror work, is particularly captivating.

One of the major highlights of the haveli is the evening cultural performance, known as the Dharohar Dance Show. Held in the open-air Neem Chowk courtyard, this show features traditional Rajasthani folk dances, puppetry, and music performed by skilled local artists. The vibrant atmosphere, rhythmic music, and colorful costumes create an unforgettable experience that celebrates Rajasthan‚Äôs folk heritage.

The haveli also offers stunning views of Lake Pichola and the surrounding palaces, making it a photographer‚Äôs delight. It‚Äôs centrally located and easy to access from other Udaipur landmarks.

Overall, Bagore Ki Haveli is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the artistic, cultural, and architectural legacy of Udaipur. It perfectly blends historical significance with vibrant local tradition.

This place speaks a lot about the rich history of Udaipur and it has traditional turbans collection, it has a wedding ceremony statues, it has weaponry room, it has the makeup room, the temple, basically all the traditional things you can imagine from the 15th and 16th century.

reviews.reviewText:
I recently visited Jagmandir Island Palace in Udaipur and it was an amazing experience.
The view is absolutely beautiful, especially at sunset.
The boat ride to the island is a little expensive during sunset time, but it's worth every penny.
The palace has such a calm and peaceful vibe.
Every corner is so pretty and perfect for taking pictures.
The gardens, the architecture, everything looks so dreamy.
I loved just walking around and soaking in the beauty.
The sunset made the whole place look even more magical.
If you are visiting Udaipur, this is a must-visit spot!
Highly recommend for a relaxing and beautiful time.

Want to experience Royalty, this is the place ! Through a nice boat ride, you get to this palace in the middle of Lake Pichola, perfect to witness one of the best sunsets in the town.

Every step you take forward after stepping down the boat, you step closer to experience that Royal experience.

Fine Dine üçΩ

We didn't stay here so cannot say much on the rooms but close look at the palace gave us a luxurious vibes. But overall the place is amazing in the middle of the lake. Beautiful garden, great restaurant. The spa therapy experience here should not be skipped.

The Darikhana Restaurant at Jagmandir Island Palace is undeniably beautiful. The setting is stunning, with peaceful views of Lake Pichola and the palace architecture providing a picturesque backdrop for a fine dining experience. The food was impressive, especially the Lotus Stem Annar ki Bhel and the Subz Biryani, both of which were flavorful and thoughtfully prepared. The biryani was aromatic, well-balanced, and served with care.

However, the service was not in line with the premium setting or pricing. We had to ask twice for sugar for our coffee, which was served nearly five minutes later, by then, the coffee was cold. When we asked the server if sugar shouldn‚Äôt have been served with the coffee, he walked away without responding or acknowledging the lapse. This lack of basic courtesy and attentiveness was disappointing.

Additionally, guests are not allowed to record videos, which felt out of place for a heritage destination that naturally invites people to capture memories.

Overall, while the location and food are excellent, the service falls short of expectations. For a restaurant located in such a prestigious setting, the guest experience‚Äîespecially in terms of hospitality and staff behavior‚Äîshould be much more refined and professional.

Jag Mandir Palace in Udaipur is truly a magical experience. Located on Lake Pichola, the boat ride itself sets the tone with serene views of the city and surrounding palaces. The architecture is stunning, with beautifully carved marble structures, lush gardens, and an aura of royalty that transports you back in time. The evening ambiance, when the palace lights up, is absolutely breathtaking. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for photography, romantic walks, or simply soaking in the history and beauty. While food and drinks are slightly expensive, the overall experience is worth it. A must-visit landmark to complete your Udaipur trip!

It‚Äôs a nice place to sit peacefully and have a drink. The only issue is that UPI doesn‚Äôt work here, so you need to carry cash. Everything is quite expensive too.

To reach here, you have to take a boat ride, which takes you around the lake before dropping you at Jagmandir. That ride itself is a good experience.

For the evening slot, price is 800‚Çπ per person.

I went to Jag Mandir with my family. We took a boat ride to reach there. The palace is very pretty with old carvings and marble work. We spent some time sitting by the water. It was a very nice and fresh experience. Must visit if you are in Udaipur!

Jag Mandir is a small palace but very special. Watching the sunset from there is the best thing. The colors of the sky and the lake together look magical. The place is neat, and the staff was friendly.

If you love taking pictures, Jag Mandir is perfect. The building, gardens, and the lake around it make every corner look like a painting. The boat ride is short but fun. It feels like you are entering a different world.

Jagmandir is undeniably a beautiful spot, perfect for scenic views and aesthetic photos.

However, beyond its charm and the picturesque surroundings, there‚Äôs not much to explore apart from the restaurant. And be warned, the restaurant is extremely expensive (to give you an idea, even a water bottle costs ‚Çπ110).

If you‚Äôre on a student trip or traveling on a budget, this might not be the best use of your time or money. You could end up spending ‚Çπ600‚Äì‚Çπ1000 on the boat ride and 3‚Äì5 hours just to visit a single palace with only a costly dining option.

So, unless you‚Äôre specifically looking for a premium experience, you may want to skip Jagmandir and explore more budget-friendly attractions in Udaipur instead.

City Palace in Udaipur is a masterpiece of regal architecture that exudes luxury at every corner. The sheer grandeur of the place, along with its rich history, felt like royalty. It‚Äôs not just a palace, but a sensory experience‚Äîluxurious, peaceful, and full of stories that captivate anyone who visits.

City Palace is beautiful and full of history, but it was very crowded when I visited. The ticket price is also quite high. If you‚Äôre someone who enjoys history and architecture, it‚Äôs worth going. Otherwise, you might want to skip it.

Visiting this palace was like stepping into a living tapestry of India‚Äôs regal past. The sheer grandeur envelops you from the moment you enter, with architecture that gracefully marries elegance and legacy. Every corridor whispers stories of a bygone era, where artistry met opulence.
From the intricately carved facades to the richly adorned queen‚Äôs chambers, the palace stuns with its attention to detail. Personal belongings preserved through time add an intimate touch, bridging centuries in quiet reverence. The interiors are not just aesthetically beautiful‚Äîthey‚Äôre deeply immersive, offering a glimpse into royal life that feels almost tangible.
I highly recommend taking a guided tour‚Äînot only for the deeper historical insights but also for discovering the hidden corners perfect for photographs. Every nook holds a narrative, and with the right guide, those stories truly come alive.
If you‚Äôre visiting Udaipur, this palace is an absolute must. It‚Äôs more than a tourist attraction; it‚Äôs a soulful experience that lingers long after you've left.

placeMetadata.name: City palace

sources.snippet: A majestic architectural marvel towering over the lake on a hill surrounded by crenelated walls, it is a conglomeration of courtyards, pavilions, terraces, corridors, rooms and hanging gardens. The main entrance is through the triple arched gate, the "Tripolia" with eight marble porticos, The Maharanas were weighed under the gate in gold, the equivalent amount of which was distributed among the populace. The surajgokhada, the balcony of the sun, is where the SuryanshiMaharanas of Mewar presented themselves to the people in the time of trouble to restore their confidence.

One of the most peaceful and beautiful spots in Udaipur. Ambrai Ghat offers a perfect view of Lake Pichola, City Palace, and the serene sunset. The vibe here is calm and reflective ‚Äî perfect for morning peace or evening chill.

Whether you‚Äôre a traveler, content creator, or just looking to relax by the lake, Ambrai Ghat is a must-visit. Clean, calm, and full of soul.

üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü Ambrai Ghat ‚Äì A Breathtaking Viewpoint You Shouldn‚Äôt Miss in Udaipur

Ambrai Ghat is truly one of the most magical spots in Udaipur! From here, you get a panoramic view of the majestic City Palace, shimmering Lake Pichola, and the stunning reflections of the palaces, ghats, and heritage buildings across the water. It‚Äôs the perfect place to take in the royal beauty of the city‚Äîall in one frame.

I first visited during the day and was mesmerized by the peaceful vibes, the cool breeze from the lake, and the sound of temple bells in the background. There are several small temples around the ghat, adding a spiritual and serene charm to the area.

The walk to Ambrai Ghat from Gangaur Ghat is an experience in itself. You cross a lovely walking bridge decorated with beautiful poles and lamps, offering picturesque views along the way. It feels like walking through a postcard scene.

Later at night, I went back hoping to catch the palace beautifully lit up‚Äîbut the main entrance to the ghat was closed. However, I found a perfect alternative: you can still enjoy the same mesmerizing night view by entering through the Ambrai Ghat Restaurant. The restaurant offers direct access to the lakefront with the same iconic view‚Äîideal for dinner with a royal backdrop.

If you‚Äôre visiting Udaipur, Ambrai Ghat is a must-see. Whether it‚Äôs for the peaceful morning lake view or the sparkling lights of the City Palace at night, it‚Äôs an unforgettable experience. Don‚Äôt miss it‚Äîwalk, sit, click photos, or just breathe in the charm of Udaipur from this beautiful spot.

Such a beautiful, cozy place to sit, relax and watch the sunset. It offers stunning views of City Palace, Taj hotel, and a grand 180 degree view of Picchola Lake. placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Located near the majestic Sajjangarh Palace, Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary offers a wild retreat in Udaipur. The sanctuary spans 1,235 acres and was established in 1884 by Maharana Sajjan Singh. It is home to diverse flora and fauna, offering opportunities for jungle safaris amidst lush greenery where visitors can spot deer, peacocks, and if lucky, even a leopard.

reviews.reviewText: The place was a 10/10, gave such a pretty view and the aesthetics of the fort were mesmerising.

A good place to visit if you‚Äôre looking to connect with nature and enjoy some peace away from the city. The sanctuary offers scenic walking trails, lush greenery, and a calm environment. One of the highlights is definitely the sunset view ‚Äî absolutely stunning and worth the wait! It‚Äôs a great spot for nature lovers, photographers, and anyone wanting a quiet time in the wild.

We came across this place on the map and thought it would be a perfect spot to catch the sunrise. Sadly, the sky was cloudy that morning, so we missed it‚Äîbut honestly, the view was still totally worth it! You can see the whole city from up there, and it‚Äôs even visible from Fateh Sagar Lake.

The drive itself was nice‚Äîwe took our own car and stopped at a few beautiful spots on the way just to soak it all in. Parking cost us ‚Çπ350, and the entry fee for the wildlife area was ‚Çπ140 per person. If you don‚Äôt have your own vehicle, you can hire a taxi that takes you right up to the palace.

The greenery around the wildlife sanctuary was lovely, and once you reach the top, the view of the mountains and city from the rooftop just takes your breath away. The palace, that is in Wildlife sanctuary built back in the 1800s, is really well maintained. It‚Äôs a peaceful place‚Äîyou can sit for a while, relax, and take some great photos.

If you‚Äôre planning to visit, I‚Äôd definitely recommend going either early in the morning or later in the evening. It opens at 9 AM and closes at 6 PM, but it gets quite crowded in the middle of the day. Also, avoid going during the peak summer heat‚Äîit gets really hot and hazy, and you won‚Äôt enjoy the view as much.

One tip: carry some water and a few snacks. There is a restaurant inside, but it‚Äôs a bit expensive, so better to eat before you go or just keep something handy.

Give yourself at least 2 to 3 hours to explore at a relaxed pace. It‚Äôs not the kind of place you want to rush through.

All in all, a lovely experience. If you‚Äôve got time in Udaipur, definitely try to fit this into your plan!

Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary offers a chance to immerse yourself in the natural beauty of Rajasthan. It's a tranquil escape from the city, perfect for nature lovers and photographers alike. Plus, exploring the sanctuary provides insights into the region's biodiversity and conservation efforts. Consider taking breaks, carrying water and snacks, and wearing comfortable clothing and shoes to make your visit more enjoyable.
