placeMetadata.name: City Palace

sources.snippet: City Palace is a stunning architectural marvel that encompasses a blend of styles from Jaipur, the Mughal Empire, the Middle Ages, Europe, and China, with a combination of modest and opulent imperial palaces, galleries, and courtyard nurseries. It is undoubtedly one of Rajasthan‚Äôs grandest palace buildings. The entire complex is built out of stone and marble, creating a regal ambience that is perfect for pre-wedding photoshoots in Udaipur.
sources.shortName: Top 22 Best Pre wedding Shoot locations in Udaipur

sources.snippet: The City Palace in Udaipur in the state of Rajasthan has a lot in its store to reveal the age-old history it possesses. The royal building is a huge complex with plenty of rooms and pillars inside. It took more than 300 years to complete the structure properly.
sources.shortName: 55 Places to Visit in Udaipur, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

placeMetadata.description: The palaces of 11 separate rulers sit together in this sprawling complex that was started in 1559.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Begin your day in Udaipur with a visit to the majestic City Palace, an iconic landmark that offers breathtaking views of the city. Constructed in 1559 by Maharana Udai Singh II, this sprawling complex has been expanded over the centuries by successive Maharanas, resulting in a stunning array of palaces and mahals. As you explore the palace, you'll be immersed in the grandeur and opulence of Rajasthan's royal history.
placeMetadata.address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

reviews.reviewText: This beutiful and elegant palace is main attraction of udaypur, Rajasthan. Its huge and royal and surrounded by city lakewhich is so beutiful. Entry free of this palace is 450/ per person but its managable cause you can feel how was the royal life when you enter in this palace. Till now king of udaypur is live on this palace and total property maintain by king. its have lake inside from where anyone can take boat ride of sorrounding and enjoy beutiful sunset on this palace. (750/ per person boat fare).

Must visit if going to Udaipur, tickeys- 450/person, senior are 350 n students are 200/ person. Water bottle fillining facilites are outside entrance. Its a 3-4 hrs journey entry is from Mardana mahal. Showcasing all artellary of soldier, horse. King descendents. A artist is there to make live sketches. Securiry is good. View from palace is amazing, one side whole city othet side pichola lake. Description is given under every imp things there, Beautiful window gazing, sheesh mahal, painting, wedding hall, Queens palace musical instruments and memorial are well kept .Many places are beautifully restored. Maps of 1600s year and many of India is displayed. Dinning place is made inside. Do take some you water vottle with you and enjoy our culture and ancestory. Not much crowded in weekedays.

A beautiful palace and fort. Well maintained and has amazing glimpses of history.
It is well organised and has all basic facilities.
It has great art works within it and lots of pics spots.
The guides there are well mannered and explain well.
Cameras are allowed and so are phones.
You may have to walk a bit from ticket counter to the main palace, but try doing it, as it has good points on the way.
Takes around 4 hours for a complete visit well but you can spend a complete day in it too and not get bored.
Closed in the night.
Ample parking facility too.

One of the most beautiful palaces in India! The history here is truly remarkable. We booked tickets with a guide, and it made the whole experience really informative. Every section was a delight‚Äîthe walls, paintings, and artifacts are absolutely stunning.
You can actually see the complete city from this palace!

City Palace in Udaipur is a masterpiece of regal architecture that exudes luxury at every corner. The sheer grandeur of the place, along with its rich history, felt like royalty. It‚Äôs not just a palace, but a sensory experience‚Äîluxurious, peaceful, and full of stories that captivate anyone who visits.

Visiting this palace was like stepping into a living tapestry of India‚Äôs regal past. The sheer grandeur envelops you from the moment you enter, with architecture that gracefully marries elegance and legacy. Every corridor whispers stories of a bygone era, where artistry met opulence.
From the intricately carved facades to the richly adorned queen‚Äôs chambers, the palace stuns with its attention to detail. Personal belongings preserved through time add an intimate touch, bridging centuries in quiet reverence. The interiors are not just aesthetically beautiful‚Äîthey‚Äôre deeply immersive, offering a glimpse into royal life that feels almost tangible.
I highly recommend taking a guided tour‚Äînot only for the deeper historical insights but also for discovering the hidden corners perfect for photographs. Every nook holds a narrative, and with the right guide, those stories truly come alive.
If you‚Äôre visiting Udaipur, this palace is an absolute must. It‚Äôs more than a tourist attraction; it‚Äôs a soulful experience that lingers long after you've left.

Very good place to visit but very costly. This palaces and forts are history of our country so it's necessary that common people can also see this places. By the way this palace is very good structure must visit place with family and friends at any season. This is in city of Udaypur of Rajasthan.

Beautiful and magnificent palace. Takes around 1.5 to 2 hours to cover. During weekends it gets very crowded and some sections of the palace are very narrow, thus it will feel suffocating. There is continuous series of exhibits in the palace so if you get bored midway it might be difficult to get out. There are quite beautiful views of the city. There's a restaurant inside the palace too.

placeMetadata.name: Jagdish Temple

sources.snippet: Built by Maharana Jagat Singh in 1651, Jagdish Temple, situated within the Udaipur City Palace is another one of the great works of architecture from the olden days. It has finely carved pillars, beautifully decorated ceilings, gorgeously painted walls, and spacious halls and corridors. Apart from this, the architectural expertise also extends itself to the pyramidal spire, mandap (prayer hall) and the porch.
sources.shortName: 55 Places to Visit in Udaipur, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: The Indo-Aryan Jagdish Temple owes its creation to the Maharana Jagat Singh. The temples in Udaipur lies near the City Palace‚Äôs Badi Pol entry and you have to go up through a few steps. The black stone deity of Lord Vishnu will awe you and so will the brass Garuda image facing it.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

placeMetadata.description: Landmark Hindu temple featuring detailed carvings on the facade, plus statues & other art.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Jagdish Temple, located in Udaipur, is a magnificent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. It was constructed by Maharana Jagat Singh in the 17th century and showcases stunning architecture with finely carved pillars and intricate ceilings. The temple's design adheres to Vedic Vastushastra principles, making it a beautiful and culturally significant site to visit.
placeMetadata.address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

reviews.reviewText:
Nestled right in the vibrant heart of Udaipur, Jagdish Temple is more than just a place of worship ‚Äî it‚Äôs a masterpiece of devotion, architecture, and history. The moment you step through its grand entrance, you are greeted by an atmosphere of peace that stands in sharp contrast to the bustling city streets just outside.

The temple‚Äôs intricate carvings are simply mesmerizing, telling stories from ancient times with astonishing detail. Every pillar and corner showcases the remarkable craftsmanship of the artisans who built it nearly 400 years ago. As you climb the elegant marble steps, the energy shifts ‚Äî it‚Äôs almost as if time slows down to let you soak in the spiritual vibe.

The idol of Lord Vishnu (in the form of Jagannath) at the sanctum is stunning and radiates a serene, almost magnetic presence. Morning and evening aartis (prayer rituals) add an extra layer of magic to the experience, filling the temple with soulful chants and the fragrance of incense.

What truly sets Jagdish Temple apart is how seamlessly it blends into the life of Udaipur ‚Äî it's a living, breathing part of the city‚Äôs soul. Whether you're a devotee, a history lover, or simply an explorer seeking hidden gems, this temple promises a deeply enriching experience.

If you‚Äôre in Udaipur, a visit to Jagdish Temple isn‚Äôt just recommended ‚Äî it‚Äôs essential.

The Jagdish temple is a marvel - one climbs the steep steps to the initial courtyard and a lovely chap looks after your shoes for no more than 50R I think. We saw Ganesha first and walked round and then entered the Temple were devotees were chanting. The atmosphere was laid back and chill.

Jagdish Mandir, located in the heart of Udaipur at Jagdish chowk in the old city.

And this temple has became an identity of Udaipur be it for any tourist or for locals.

This temple has been built by "Maharana Jagat Singh I". This is an exceptional example of Rajput architecture.
Mandir ko banane ka maksad sirf bhakti nahi tha, balki Mewar ki shaan aur kala ki takat dikhana bhi tha.
The temple has 50 beautifully carved pillars which is just wow, what a wonder.

The evening aarti at Jagdish Mandir is truly a divine experience. The lamps, the sound of temple bells, and the chants of devotees create a powerful and peaceful atmosphere that you really have to feel for yourself.

The location of Jagdish Mandir is also super convenient it's right in the heart of Udaipur. You won‚Äôt just visit the temple, but also get the chance to explore some amazing nearby spots like
* Lake pichola (just a short walk or you can take auto/taxi, etc.)
* city palace (literally walking distance from the maintemple)
* Hathi pol & ashwini bazar (market famous for local art and handicraft)
* Gangaur ghat (a ghat which is a great place to explore from there you'll see the iconic city palace's view).

Plus, since the temple is located in the Old City, you‚Äôll find some really charming cafes in the narrow lanes perfect for grabbing a bite or coffee after sightseeing. The whole area is quite popular amongst the tourists, so you‚Äôll always see a lively vibe with travelers exploring the streets and having the best time.

This famous temple offers a truly peaceful experience. Its ancient walls whisper tales of history, inviting you to step back in time and connect with a profound sense of serenity. A visit here is not just a sightseeing trip, but a journey for the soul, leaving you with a lasting sense of calm and reverence. Don't miss the opportunity to immerse yourself in its sacred atmosphere and rich heritage.

This temple is very peaceful being situated at very hot spot. And try to visit for its Aarti in evening 7pm. There is bhajan and kirtans going and you will just get lost into the devotion.
The architecture of the temple is very beautiful with intricate carvings, telling stories from ancient times.

The temple architecture is unmatched and glorified the richness of skills and devotion in ancient Indian civilization. I am proud to be a Hindu and also came to see this temple and witness  the glory of the mewar family and their contribution in dharma.
‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡§ø ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§É

We were honestly just stunned by the level of detail in this place‚Äîevery corner had something going on. Intricate carvings, beautifully done ceilings, and walls that felt like storybooks. The temple is a three-story structure, with the main shrine dedicated to Lord Vishnu. And while we don‚Äôt really know much about temples or the deeper meanings behind everything, we do know good architecture when we see it‚Äîand this one was something else.

The walls are painted with scenes from Hindu mythology‚ÄîRamayana, Mahabharata, all of it‚Äîand even without knowing every reference, it‚Äôs hard not to be impressed. Everything looked so carefully crafted, like someone had poured their entire soul into every detail.

We took over a hundred pictures, not even kidding. These are just a few clicks we decided to post, but trust us, we could‚Äôve made a whole photo album out of it. If you‚Äôre even a little into architecture or historical design, this place is a must-visit.

Also‚Äîmajor plus‚Äîit‚Äôs free. No entry fee, no fancy ticket. It‚Äôs a temple, open to all, which just adds to how cool and accessible it feels.

Only reason we‚Äôre giving it 4 stars instead of 5? The maintenance. Or rather, the lack of it. It‚Äôs honestly sad to see something this beautiful, something people actively worship, just not being taken care of. The structure deserves so much more respect. The government seriously needs to wake up and put some effort into preserving places like this. If you‚Äôre gonna call it cultural heritage, then treat it like one.

Jagdish Temple stands as the largest and one of the most beautiful temples in Udaipur, both architecturally and spiritually. It continues to hold immense significance for devotees and visitors to the city, remaining a testament to Udaipur‚Äôs rich royal and cultural heritage

placeMetadata.name: City palace

sources.snippet: A majestic architectural marvel towering over the lake on a hill surrounded by crenelated walls, it is a conglomeration of courtyards, pavilions, terraces, corridors, rooms and hanging gardens. The main entrance is through the triple arched gate, the "Tripolia" with eight marble porticos, The Maharanas were weighed under the gate in gold, the equivalent amount of which was distributed among the populace. The surajgokhada, the balcony of the sun, is where the SuryanshiMaharanas of Mewar presented themselves to the people in the time of trouble to restore their confidence.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Udaipur, Tourist Places, Points of Interest

sources.snippet: The true reflection of the grandeur of Rajasthan, City Palace is amongst the top places to visit in Udaipur. It is a conglomeration of several buildings and towers and is better recognized as a Palace Complex. Belonging to the royal Mewar family, City Palace has a number of features that greatly attract tourists.
sources.shortName: The Top 30 Must-Visit Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: Shilpgram is a crafts fair and is organized annually in the west side of the city of Udaipur. It aims to promote the art, craft, textile and handicrafts of Rajasthan. This state is famous for handicrafts, bandhej, tie and dye, mirror work and embroideries.

placeMetadata.description: Large village featuring traditional huts of regional tribal peoples, plus cultural performances.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Shilpgram, located on the outskirts of Udaipur, Rajasthan, is a sprawling open-air museum spread across 70 acres. It serves as a living ethnographic museum showcasing the cultural heritage and traditional arts and crafts of various ethnic communities from rural India. The village features traditional huts representing the lifestyle of regional tribal peoples such as Bhil, Mina, Garasia, Kathodi, and Saharia.
placeMetadata.address: JM66+9JP, Shilpgram, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313011, India

reviews.reviewText:
Shilpgram showcases culture of Rajasthan, it also has old age houses built in parts of India. This is a place where you get to see folk dance, folk music, folk art of Rajasthan. If you plan to visit here you should have 1 hour to 2 hour of time to properly and completely see what all they have placed in this place.

You can also shop souvenirs from Shilpgram.

This is a very interesting place. Must visit if you have kids to introduce them to real indian village culture. We hired a guide named "Ram". He was very good and so humble and enthusiastic to share information about the various culture. Also the dance performances and puppet show are very entertaining.

Shilpgram showcases culture of Rajasthan, it also has old age houses built in parts of India. This is a place where you get to see folk dance, folk music, folk art of Rajasthan. If you plan to visit here you should have 1 hour to 2 hour of time to properly and completely see what all they have placed in this place.

You can also shop souvenirs from Shilpgram.

It‚Äôs huge place, a day isn‚Äôt enough to see & feel unfortunately it‚Äôs a bit dusty not well maintained ; perhaps nature will do justice in next few weeks _I did ask the locals to entertain sing a folk song üéµ üé∂ and sincerely they did a fine job‚Ä¶ happy to tip just to encourage

This is a very interesting place. Must visit if you have kids to introduce them to real indian village culture.

Shilpgram has a lot to offer at one place. They have meticulously made as an amalgamation of both showcasing Rajasthani traditions and empowering the local artisans. It easily takes 1-2 hours to fully experience what it offers.
There is a restaurant, open air theatre, multiple exhibits, museum and outlets to explore. In an hour spend, I could witness the performance of three different talent groups all at one place. One of the best place to spend time during Udaipur City trip.

You can roam around to see the things and some arts. If you want you can buy. People will be persuasive while selling so buy only if you need it.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Udaipur, often referred to as the 'City of Lakes', is a mesmerizing destination that offers a perfect blend of history, culture, and stunning landscapes. With its majestic palaces, serene lakes, and vibrant gardens, every corner of this enchanting city presents a picture-perfect moment waiting to be captured. From the intricate architecture of the City Palace to the tranquil waters of Lake Pichola, Udaipur is a photographer's dream, offering countless opportunities to create lasting memories.

As you wander through the charming streets and lush gardens, you'll discover hidden gems like the serene Ambrai Ghat and the ornate Bagore Ki Haveli, each providing unique backdrops for your photos. Whether you're capturing the golden hues of sunset over Fateh Sagar Lake or the intricate details of the Jagdish Temple, Udaipur's beauty is sure to inspire your creativity. So grab your camera and get ready to explore the best photo spots that this captivating city has to offer!
